hotspots.hotspot:
Russia

  • Spans the continents of Europe and Asia
  • Largest country in the world
  • 1.8 times the size of the United States
  • Pollution is a major problem

Ukraine

  • Located on the European continent
  • About the size of Texas
  • Location of the 1986 Chernobyl nuclear accident
  • Lingering environmental issues due to radiation contamination

scene.credits: (tr)Lauren Burke/Photographer's Choice RF/Getty Images, (bkgd)Image Source/Getty Images.
(tr)Lauren Burke/Photographer's Choice RF/Getty Images, (bkgd)Image Source/Getty Images.

hotspots.hotspot:
India

  • Second most populated country in the world
  • Expected to surpass China as the most populated
  • Many parts of India suffer frequent drought as well as widespread, destructive flooding.

Indonesia

  • Made up of 17,508 islands, but only 6,000 are inhabited
  • Has the most volcanoes of any country in the world
  • Site of the deadly 2004 tsunami

Sri Lanka

  • Made up of mostly low, flat to rolling plains
  • Mountains are located in the south-central part of the country's interior.
  • Environmental problems--deforestation and pollution
  • Working to stabilize both population growth and growth of urban areas

Bangladesh

  • Has taken steps to slow population growth
  • Has issues with disease and landlessness

scene.credits: (tr)Lauren Burke/Photographer's Choice RF/Getty Images, (bkgd)Image Source/Getty Images.

scene.matchingInstructions: Match the items on the left to the correct areas on the right.

drops.drop: 1. Many landless people forced to live on flood-prone land where waterborne diseases are prevalent
2. Most populated country in the world
3. Site of a serious natural disaster, a tsunami, in 2004
4. Anticipated to become the most populated country in the world
5. Has developed strategies for stabilizing population growth and growth of urban areas
